title: Dreams and Aspirations of Junior High School Students

content.text: Listen to the following reel Rose posted on Instagram. Pay attention to the way Rose pronounces the contractions 've/'s/hasn't/haven't. Listen to it as many times as needed

content.text: As Junior High School graduates, my friends and Iâ€™ve thought about our future. Iâ€˜ve always wanted to be a singer and my passion for music has only grown stronger over the years. I havenâ€™t had any formal training, but Iâ€™ve been in the singing school club, which is like Glee. The positive feedback from my teacher has been incredibly encouraging. Heâ€™s told me I sing very well. So, my dream is to pursue higher education in music and turn my passion into a successful career. My friend Samantha has a deep love for traveling, and her adventurous spiritâ€™s taken her several cities around the country. However, sheâ€™s yet to explore the beauty of Europe, which has always been on her bucket list. Her dream is to travel around the world. She envisions herself as a flight attendant, a profession that perfectly aligns with her love for exploration and connecting with several people. On the other hand, our friend George hasnâ€™t made any decision about what to do after finishing Jr. High School. Heâ€™s been aware of the importance of making the right decision and believes that seeking guidance is essential. Heâ€™s heard about vocational guidance coaching, and he sees it as a valuable opportunity to explore various career options. The possibilities seem endless, we are excited to embrace this new chapter in our life with an open mind and determination.
